message.content: Quick qa test - can you call some mcp tools? like context7 look ups?

content.thinking: The user wants me to test MCP tools - specifically Context7 lookups. Let me try calling a couple of MCP tools to verify they work.

content.text: Sure, let me test a few MCP tools.

input.query: Bubble Tea v2 TUI framework for Go

content.content: [{"name":"justfile-best-practices.md","uri":"file:///docs/guides/justfile-best-practices.md","description":"Comprehensive guide for creating maintainable justfile structures in polyglot repositories with multiple programming languages and build systems.","mimeType":"text/markdown","server":"just"},{"name":"config.json","uri":"file:///config.json","description":"Current runtime configuration and system state of the just-mcp server","mimeType":"application/json","server":"just"}]

- Title: Bubble Tea

- Source Reputation: High

- Title: Bubble Tea Bubbles
- Context7-compatible library ID: /charmbracelet/bubbles
- Description: Bubbles provides a collection of interactive components for building terminal-based applications with Bubble Tea, including spinners, text inputs, text areas, tables, progress bars, paginators, viewports, and lists.

- Title: Bubble Tea App Template

content.text:
Both MCP servers responded fine:

- **Context7**: Resolved "bubbletea" — found `/charmbracelet/bubbletea` (90 snippets), the pkg.go.dev mirror (370 snippets), and bubbles (88 snippets). All high reputation.
- **just**: Listed 2 resources — justfile best practices guide and runtime config.

Let me also verify a doc query works.

All working. Context7 returned Bubble Tea v2 docs with code examples for `tea.NewProgram` and `p.Run()`.

MCP tools are healthy — Context7 (resolve + query) and just (resources) all responding normally.
